title: HTML/CSS - Advanced Level
description: Master advanced HTML/CSS including advanced layouts, animations, and performance

questions.question: What is CSS Subgrid?
questions.explanation: Subgrid allows grid to align with parent grid lines.

questions.question: What is CSS aspect-ratio property?
questions.explanation: aspect-ratio maintains proportional relationship between width and height.

questions.question: What is CSS Cascade Layers?
questions.explanation: Cascade layers organize cascade into explicit layers with @layer.

questions.question: What is Container Queries?
questions.explanation: Container queries apply styles based on parent container size.

questions.question: What is CSS Logical Properties?
questions.explanation: Logical properties adapt to writing mode (LTR/RTL, vertical/horizontal).

questions.question: What is CSS scroll-snap?
questions.explanation: scroll-snap creates snap positions during scrolling.

questions.question: What is position: sticky?
questions.explanation: sticky switches between relative and fixed based on scroll position.

questions.question: What is CSS Grid auto-fit vs auto-fill?
options: auto-fit collapses empty tracks, auto-fill keeps them
questions.explanation: auto-fit collapses empty tracks, auto-fill keeps empty tracks.

questions.question: What is CSS backdrop-filter?
questions.explanation: backdrop-filter applies filter effects to element's backdrop.

questions.question: What is CSS clip-path?
questions.explanation: clip-path creates clipping region to show only part of element.

questions.question: What is CSS variable scoping?
questions.explanation: CSS variables inherit through cascade, scoped by selector.

questions.question: What is CSS content-visibility?
questions.explanation: content-visibility skips rendering of off-screen content for performance.

questions.question: What is will-change CSS property?
questions.explanation: will-change hints browser about future changes for optimization.

questions.question: What is CSS alignment in Grid?
questions.explanation: justify-* for inline axis, align-* for block axis in Grid.

questions.question: What is CSS overflow-wrap?
questions.explanation: overflow-wrap controls where long words can be broken.

questions.question: What is CSS display: contents?
questions.explanation: display: contents makes element's children behave as if element didn't exist.

questions.question: What is CSS :has() selector?
questions.explanation: :has() is parent selector - selects element that has specified descendant.

questions.question: What is CSS Cascade Layers for?
questions.explanation: Cascade layers let you organize and control cascade order explicitly.

questions.question: What is CSS scrollbar styling?
questions.explanation: CSS can style scrollbar: ::-webkit-scrollbar, ::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb, etc.

questions.question: What is CSS containment value all?
questions.explanation: containment: layout style paint size provides maximum containment for performance.
